briefdescription.para: Helper to declare elements of bt_codec_data arrays.

detaileddescription.para: This macro is mainly for creating an array of struct bt_codec_data elements inside bt_codec which is then passed to the likes of bt_audio_stream_config or bt_audio_stream_reconfig.

parameterdescription.para: Codec Specific Data in LVT format
Codec Specific Metadata in LVT format

memberdef.name: BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_ANY
memberdef.initializer: (BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_NONE | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_VOICE | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_MEDIA | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_INSTRUCTION | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_ATTENTION | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_ALERT | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_MAN_MACHINE | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_EMERGENCY | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_RINGTONE | \ BT_CODEC_META_CONTEXT_TV)

briefdescription.para: Helper to declare elements of bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare Input Unframed bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare Output Unframed bt_code *.
Helper to declare Input/Output Unframed bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare Input Framed bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare Output Framed bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare Output Framed bt_codec_qos.
Helper to declare elements of bt_codec_qos_pref.

detaileddescription.para: Helper to declare an LC3 preset structure
Mandatory to support as both unicast client and server
Mandatory to support as unicast server
Mandatory to support as both broadcast source and sink
Mandatory to support as broadcast sink
Mandatory to support as both broadcast source and sink
Mandatory to support as broadcast sink

memberdef.argsstring: )(struct bt_conn *conn, struct bt_codec *codec, struct bt_audio_ep *ep, struct bt_audio_discover_params *params)
memberdef.name: bt_audio_discover_func_t

briefdescription.para: Discover Audio capabilities and endpoints callback function.

detaileddescription.para: If discovery procedure has complete both cap and ep are set to NULL.

briefdescription.para: Register Audio callbacks for a stream.

detaileddescription.para: Register Audio callbacks for a stream.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: Only one callback structure can be registered, and attempting to registering more than one will result in an error.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: May only unregister a callback structure that has previously been registered by bt_audio_unicast_server_register_cb().

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to discover remote capabilities and endpoints and notifies via params callback.

simplesect.para: This procedure is asynchronous therefore the parameters need to remains valid while it is active.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_conn *conn, struct bt_audio_stream *stream, struct bt_audio_ep *ep, struct bt_codec *codec)
memberdef.name: bt_audio_stream_config

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to configure a new stream using the remote endpoint, local capability and codec configuration.

simplesect.para: Allocated Audio Stream object or NULL in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to reconfigure a stream using the a different local capability and/or codec configuration.
This can only be done for unicast streams.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to configure the Quality of Service of streams in a unicast group. All streams in the group for the specified conn will have the Quality of Service configured. This shall only be used to configure unicast streams.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to enable a stream.
This shall only be called for unicast streams, as broadcast streams will always be enabled once created.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to change the metadata of a stream.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to disable a stream.
This shall only be called for unicast streams, as broadcast streams will always be enabled once created.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to make a stream start streaming.
This shall only be called for unicast streams. Broadcast sinks will always be started once synchronized, and broadcast source streams shall be started with bt_audio_broadcast_source_start().

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to make a stream stop streaming.
This shall only be called for unicast streams. Broadcast sinks cannot be stopped. Broadcast sources shall be stopped with bt_audio_broadcast_source_stop().

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This procedure is used by a client to release a unicast or broadcast source stream.

Broadcast sink streams cannot be released, but can be deleted by bt_audio_broadcast_sink_delete(). Broadcast source streams cannot be released, but can be deleted by bt_audio_broadcast_source_delete().

parameterdescription.para: True to cache the codec configuration or false to forget it

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: Send data from buffer to the stream.

simplesect.para: Data will not be sent to linked streams since linking is only consider for procedures affecting the state machine.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer containing data to be sent.

simplesect.para: Bytes sent in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new audio unicast group with one or more audio streams as a unicast client. Streams in a unicast group shall share the same interval, framing and latency (see bt_codec_qos).

parameterdescription.para: Array of stream objects being used for the group.
Pointer to the unicast group created

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Delete a audio unicast group as a client. All streams in the group shall be in the idle or configured state.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the unicast group to delete

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_audio_stream *streams, uint8_t num_stream, struct bt_codec *codec, struct bt_codec_qos *qos, struct bt_audio_broadcast_source **source)
memberdef.name: bt_audio_broadcast_source_create

detaileddescription.para: Create a new audio broadcast source with one or more audio streams.
The broadcast source will be visible for scanners once this has been called, and the device will advertise audio announcements.
No audio data can be sent until bt_audio_broadcast_source_start() has been called and no audio information (BIGInfo) will be visible to scanners (see bt_le_per_adv_sync_cb).

parameterdescription.para: Array of stream objects being used for the broadcaster. This array shall remain valid for the duration of the broadcast source.
Pointer to the broadcast source created

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Reconfigure an audio broadcast source with a new codec and codec quality of service parameters.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Start an audio broadcast source with one or more audio streams. The broadcast source will start advertising BIGInfo, and audio data can be streamed.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Stop an audio broadcast source. The broadcast source will stop advertising BIGInfo, and audio data can no longer be streamed.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Delete an audio broadcast source. The broadcast source will stop advertising entirely, and the source can no longer be used.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Starts a scan for broadcast sources. Scan results will be received by the scan_recv callback. Only reports from devices advertising broadcast audio support will be sent. Note that a broadcast source may advertise broadcast audio capabilities, but may not be streaming.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Stops ongoing scanning for broadcast sources.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_audio_broadcast_sink *sink, uint32_t indexes_bitfield, struct bt_audio_stream *streams, struct bt_codec *codec, const uint8_t broadcast_code[16])
memberdef.name: bt_audio_broadcast_sink_sync

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the sink object from the base_recv callback.
Bitfield of the BIS index to sync to. To sync to e.g. BIS index 1 and 2, this should have the value of BIT(1) | BIT(2).
Stream objects to be used for the receiver. If multiple BIS indexes shall be synchronized, multiple streams shall be provided.
The 16-octet broadcast code. Shall be supplied if the broadcast is encrypted (see the syncable callback).

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: Stop an audio broadcast sink. The broadcast sink will stop receiving BIGInfo, and audio data can no longer be streamed.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Once a broadcast sink has been allocated after the pa_synced callback, it can be deleted using this function. If the sink has synchronized to any broadcast audio streams, these must first be stopped using bt_audio_stream_stop.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the sink object to delete.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.
